algorithm_technique: Use a hash map for key-value encryption mapping and a counter for decrypted word frequencies.
Pre-compute encrypted dictionary words for efficient decryption lookup.
problem_summary_simple: Encrypt strings using a key-value mapping and count valid decrypted strings from a dictionary.
problem_summary_technical: Maps characters to 2-char strings for encryption; decrypts by counting pre-encrypted dictionary words.
time_complexity: ctor: O(m + d), encrypt: O(n), decrypt: O(n)
key_insights: The encryption is a direct character-to-string substitution.
Decryption involves checking if an encrypted string matches any pre-encrypted dictionary words.
Using a counter for dictionary words significantly speeds up decryption.
